name: lindna
title: lindna
description: <text lang="en">Draws linear maps of DNA constructs</text> </description>

e_infile.prompt: Commands to the lindna drawing program file

format.python: ("", " -infile=" + str(value))[value is not None ]

e_maxgroups.prompt: Maximum number of groups (value greater than or equal to 1)

format.python: ("", " -maxgroups=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_maxlabels.prompt: Maximum number of labels (value greater than or equal to 1)

format.python: ("", " -maxlabels=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]
(" -noruler", "")[ bool(value) ]
("", " -blocktype=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]
("", " -intersymbol=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_intercolour.prompt: Colour of junctions between blocks (enter a colour number) (value from 0 to 15)

format.python: ("", " -intercolour=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]
("", " -interticks")[ bool(value) ]

e_gapsize.prompt: Interval between ticks in the ruler (value greater than or equal to 0)

format.python: ("", " -gapsize=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_ticklines.prompt: Vertical lines at the ruler's ticks

format.python: ("", " -ticklines")[ bool(value) ]

e_textheight.prompt: Height of text multiplier (value greater than or equal to 0.0)

format.python: ("", " -textheight=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_textheight.comment: <text lang="en">Height of text. Enter a number <1.0 or >1.0 to decrease or increase the size, respectively</text> </comment>

e_textlength.prompt: Length of text multiplier (value greater than or equal to 0.0)

format.python: ("", " -textlength=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_textlength.comment: <text lang="en">Length of text. Enter a number <1.0 or >1.0 to decrease or increase the size, respectively</text> </comment>

e_margin.prompt: Width of left margin multiplier (value greater than or equal to 0.0)

format.python: ("", " -margin=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_margin.comment: <text lang="en">Width of left margin. This is the region left to the groups where the names of the groups are displayed. Enter a number <1.0 or >1.0 to decrease or increase the size, respectively</text> </comment>

e_tickheight.prompt: Height of ticks multiplier (value greater than or equal to 0.0)

format.python: ("", " -tickheight=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_tickheight.comment: <text lang="en">Height of ticks. Enter a number <1.0 or >1.0 to decrease or increase the size, respectively</text> </comment>

e_blockheight.prompt: Height of blocks multilpier (value greater than or equal to 0.0)

format.python: ("", " -blockheight=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_blockheight.comment: <text lang="en">Height of blocks. Enter a number <1.0 or >1.0 to decrease or increase the size, respectively</text> </comment>

e_rangeheight.prompt: Height of range ends multiplier (value greater than or equal to 0.0)

format.python: ("", " -rangeheight=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_rangeheight.comment: <text lang="en">Height of range ends. Enter a number <1.0 or >1.0 to decrease or increase the size, respectively</text> </comment>

e_gapgroup.prompt: Space between groups mutliplier (value greater than or equal to 0.0)

format.python: ("", " -gapgroup=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_gapgroup.comment: <text lang="en">Space between groups. Enter a number <1.0 or >1.0 to decrease or increase the size, respectively</text> </comment>

e_postext.prompt: Space between text and ticks, blocks, and ranges multiplier (value greater than or equal to 0.0)

format.python: ("", " -postext=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

e_postext.comment: <text lang="en">Space between text and ticks, blocks, and ranges. Enter a number <1.0 or >1.0 to decrease or increase the size, respectively</text> </comment>

format.python: (" -graphout=" + str(vdef), " -graphout=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]
("" , " -goutfile=" + str(value))[value is not None]
" -auto -stdout"

comment: <text lang="en">This program carries out the Fitch-Margoliash and Least Squares methods, plus a variety of others of the same family, with the assumption that all tip species are contemporaneous, and that there is an evolutionary clock (in effect, a molecular clock). This means that branches of the tree cannot be of arbitrary length, but are constrained so that the total length from the root of the tree to any species is the same.</text> </comment>
